title: Amazon.com is sued over alleged sale of contaminated rice By Reuters
summary: Amazon is facing a proposed class action lawsuit alleging it sold various types of rice contaminated with high levels of arsenic and other heavy metals, based on a recent study. The lawsuit covers 18 products, including those from Amazon-owned Whole Foods' 365 brand, and seeks at least $5 million in damages for alleged consumer protection violations.

title: Oracle to buy $40 billion of Nvidia chips for OpenAI’s US data center, FT reports By Reuters
summary: Oracle plans to spend $40 billion on Nvidia chips to power a new OpenAI data center in Texas, part of the US Stargate Project aimed at boosting domestic AI capabilities. This initiative will help OpenAI reduce dependence on Microsoft and allow Oracle to enhance its cloud computing services to better compete with market leaders.

title: Amazon not seeing notable impact from tariffs yet, Q2 revenue tracking higher By Investing.com
summary: Amazon reports that it is not currently experiencing a significant negative impact from tariffs. Furthermore, the company's second-quarter revenue is reportedly tracking higher.

title: Wall St falls as Trump tariff threats spark market uncertainty By Reuters
summary: US stocks experienced a significant decline on Friday and for the week, primarily due to President Trump's renewed threats of 50% tariffs on European goods and potential tariffs on Apple products. This action reignited global trade tensions, increasing market uncertainty and leading to broad losses, particularly in technology, communication services, and consumer discretionary sectors.

title: Celebrities unite at exclusive Cannes gala to support AIDS research after Trump cuts By Reuters
summary: Celebrities attended the amfAR charity dinner at the Cannes Film Festival to raise money for AIDS research. Attendees expressed concern over potential negative impacts on global health efforts due to recent U.S. funding cuts.

title: Disney seeks to stop YouTube from hiring veteran to oversee sports and media By Reuters
summary: Walt Disney has filed a lawsuit against Alphabet's YouTube to prevent it from hiring former Disney executive Justin Connolly as its global head of media and sports. Disney alleges breach of contract, claiming Connolly was under contract until March 2027, while YouTube seeks to leverage his expertise for its expanding media and sports initiatives.

title: Ackman’s hedge fund Pershing Square bets on Amazon, exits Canadian Pacific By Reuters
summary: Billionaire investor Bill Ackman's hedge fund, Pershing Square, made a substantial investment in Amazon shares last month. The fund cited confidence in Amazon's continued earnings growth, resilience to tariffs, and management's ability to expand profit margins as reasons for the purchase.

title: U.S. stocks mixed at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.00% By Investing.com
summary: The article reports on the mixed close of the U.S. stock market, with the Dow flat, S&P 500 slightly down, and Nasdaq slightly up. It details the performance of various sectors and individual stocks, noting that Amazon (AMZN) was among the best performers on the day, gaining 0.99%.

title: Amazon stock rises following Pershing Square’s stake reveal By Investing.com
summary: Amazon shares rose after Bill Ackman's Pershing Square revealed a new stake in the company, citing the strategic value of AWS and retail segments, an attractive valuation following a price dip, and confidence in future earnings growth. Pershing Square believes concerns over AWS slowdown and tariffs are temporary and sees significant upside potential.

title: Amazon tests AI audio summaries for products, expanding tech giant’s AI push (May 21) By Reuters
summary: Amazon is testing AI-powered short-form audio summaries for products on its platform, analyzing details and reviews to provide highlights. This new feature is part of Amazon's broader push to integrate artificial intelligence across its services, following recent AI initiatives like Rufus and generative AI for Alexa. The test is currently available to a limited number of U.S. customers with plans for wider expansion.

title: Startup Anthropic says its new AI model can code for hours at a time By Reuters
summary: AI startup Anthropic, backed by Amazon, has launched its new top-tier AI model, Claude Opus 4, which demonstrates significantly improved autonomous coding capabilities, working for hours at a time. The company aims for greater economic and productivity impact through these advancements, also releasing a smaller model, Sonnet 4, and making its Claude Code tool generally available.

title: Google faces DOJ probe over Character.AI deal, Bloomberg Law reports By Reuters
summary: The U.S. Justice Department is reportedly probing Google's agreement with AI startup Character.AI for potential antitrust violations, examining if the deal was structured to avoid formal merger review. This investigation is in its early stages and follows similar scrutiny of other tech giants, including Amazon and Microsoft, who made comparable AI talent and technology deals.

title: US climate pullback threatens planned debt-for-nature deals By Reuters
summary: The article reports that billions of dollars in planned debt-for-nature swaps, which exchange debt relief for conservation commitments, are at risk due to potential withdrawal of crucial U.S. backing from the DFC under a possible Trump administration. This uncertainty threatens deals aimed at protecting vital ecosystems globally, as the DFC has been a key provider of political risk insurance, and finding alternatives may be difficult.

title: Wall Street stocks end mostly flat in choppy trade as Treasury yields ease By Reuters
summary: U.S. stocks ended mostly flat in a choppy session, recovering from earlier losses as Treasury yields eased after hitting recent highs. The market reacted to the House passing a tax and spending bill expected to increase the national debt, while investors also weighed concerns about tariffs and interest rates.

title: Stock market today: S&P 500 ends flat as US debt concerns weigh on sentiment By Investing.com
summary: The S&P 500 closed flat despite fragile market sentiment driven by concerns over high U.S. debt levels, with dip-buying in tech helping to stabilize the market after a previous day's slump. Economic data indicated a still-solid labor market, while the House passed a controversial tax and spending bill.
